experience: You and Christian both know Adam Wehunt
While driving the other day, I got a bit choked up.
A feeling of overwhelming gratitude sunk into my heart when I considered what I am doing for my job.
I literally had a client say "You're building my dreams."
My work doesn't feel like work.
Building software, apps and web tools for businesses brings life to a brainchild someone may have had for years.
It is worth all of the time and effort.
I love my life. I love my job.
If you want to chat about an idea you've had, or want help making your idea a reality, let me know.
I'd be so grateful to be your friend, and to help you find success in any way I can.

Recently I was in an airport restaurant, waiting to be seated. Every dining party on the list had a ‚Äú1‚Äù next to the name, meaning each represented a party of one. All 8 of us were going to different tables to eat alone.

I looked at the person next to me - who I had me never seen before - and said, ‚Äúhow would you like to eat together?‚Äù This person accepted my invite, although she told me afterwards that she was a little hesitant at first. Come to find out she had a PHD in food science. The conversation was fascinating! After our conversation she commented that she wished she did that kind of stuff more often.
Would you eat with a stranger in an airport? Why or why not?
I've spent the past few weeks trying to recruit a UX designer on my team at Chegg.
In doing so, I realized how difficult it is to find, communicate with, schedule time with and identify the right candidates.
I wanted to give a shout out to recruiters everywhere who spend their days doing this!
For 6 months, I paid my entire team through my personal credit card.
I was tens of thousands of dollars in debt, but I kept it all as a secret.

My operations manager knew we were struggling financially and asked me why we won't just let go of some of our designers. She told me 'you have to take care of yourself first before we can take care of the others.'
In a way, she was right. I had horrible anxiety daily, thinking about all the money going out of the account, but no steady revenue coming in.
I worked long hours just to make sure that our business would stay afloat. It was horrible, but I had no intention of letting anyone go.
When I find someone incredible, I invest in them. If they're unicorns, why would I want to give them away to another company?
Paying them with credit card SUCKED, but it was my way of investing in my team when times were hard.
Now, at Wander, we're doing better than ever. We're having the opposite problem of having too many leads and clients for our team to keep up with and can't seem to hire fast enough.
I have my dream team and I would've given all of that up, had I not kept them around.
The point is, invest in your team. They will provide you with better ROI than any other investment. And without them, there is no company.

Specialize in identifying perfect candidates AKA unicorns for job positions in the technology industry. Work directly with both hiring managers and candidates to ensure a great fit between employee and job role and play a significant role in the hiring process Responsible for recruiting IT and Engineering professionals for clientele based across the United States, primarily in the Greater Salt Lake Area that consist of 3 counties | Davis | Salt Lake | Utah  - Full Cycle recruitment - Maintain book of business.- Place qualified professionals in contract, contract-hire, and permanent positions- Build relationships with potential candidates and maintain a pipeline of pre-qualified candidates through networking, employee referrals, and cold calls.- Participate in training and creation of company procedures (new hires, database rules, improved communication via separate departments within company, etc.)- Negotiate compensation, benefits, PTO, relocation assistance, start date, counter offers, and growth potential with candidates throughout screening and offer stages.- Establish an essential relationship with each Account Executive as to gather information regarding each hiring managers need, and to help identify any realistic expectations that need to be given due to compensation changes, skill sets desired, etc. of candidates presented.

summary: My passion is finding people jobs and making sure I have fulfilled each individuals needs/wants to go with their career advancement. I strive to make sure every candidate I place is happy in the company I put them in. It is the best feeling having conversations with candidates and getting to know what drives them, makes them happy, what their passionate about, etc. and then put my recruiting expertise into play and match them with a hiring manager looking for their type of talent. Nothing better then waking up every morning having the chance to work with great co-workers day to day and work with great IT talent out here in Salt Lake City to help them advance in their career and give their family a stable/enjoyable life.ConsultNet offers IT and Engineering professional services to startup, midmarket, and Fortune 1000 companies in North America. We specialize in providing thoughtful and effective solutions for our clients and rewarding opportunities for our consultants. We are the proud recipient of both the Talent and Client 2016 Best of Staffing awards, and the 2014 and 2015 TechServe Alliance Excellence awards. We're a principled talent acquisition and consulting firm that combines professional integrity with technical and industry expertise.ConsultNet.com https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/ConsultNet-Reviews-E32109.htmIf you have any further questions, please reach out to me 801-997-6245 / 801-209-7142 / chebert@consultnet.com
